title: Enhancing Nursing Practical Competencies: Microgrid Cybersecurity Reinforcement through Reinforcement Learning-Based Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Practical competency enhancement program for medical/nursing field practitioners

learning_goals: Explain control layer design methods for responding to adversarial cyberattacks using reinforcement learning-based FedSAC algorithms

Learners can simulate the implementation of Federated Reinforcement Learning (FRL) in a distributed microgrid environment within a week by: (1) selecting FRL algorithms and setting up the environment, (2) configuring ≥3 microgrid nodes, (3) verifying convergence through ≥10 iterative learning cycles, and (4) documenting a 15% energy efficiency improvement in a simulation report.
Propose strategies to minimize the sim-to-real gap based on experimental results from the GridLAB-D/HELICS platform
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
